heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 13 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 49.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3288 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7220 lux), cloud levels (up 328 m), and inside temperature (up 2.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 0.1m higher than yesterday, 13.9m lower than the past week, 327.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 1043m and a peak of 1366m, averaging 1235.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

Today’s average dew point temperature is 0.2°C lower than yesterday, 0.3°C lower than the past week, 0.4°C lower than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 7.6°C minimum and 9.5°C maximum, with an average of 8.5°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 8.8°C and 8.8°C.

summary.summary: Inside; on the cooler side. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dim outside. Stable conditions are expected under a high pressure system.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (88%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
